jobs.title: Print Jobs
jobs.subtitle: View and manage print jobs across all printers

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Configure your CUPS server connection and preferences
settings.serverConnectionDesc: Configure the CUPS server you want to manage.
settings.serverAddressDesc: The hostname or IP address of your CUPS server.
settings.preferencesDesc: Customize the UI behavior and notifications.
settings.refreshIntervalDesc: How often to refresh data (in seconds). Set to 0 to disable.
settings.darkModeDesc: Use dark theme for the interface.
settings.jobNotificationsDesc: Show browser notifications for job status changes.
settings.showCompletedDesc: Display completed jobs in the jobs list.
settings.dangerZoneDesc: Destructive actions that cannot be undone.
settings.clearAllJobsDesc: Cancel and remove all pending print jobs.

cupsdEditor.infoDescription: This tool generates a cupsd.conf file. You will need to manually copy the generated content and paste it into the configuration file on your CUPS server.
cupsdEditor.serverSettingsDesc: Configure logging, ports, and listening addresses.
cupsdEditor.logLevelDesc: Set the verbosity of CUPS logging. Use 'debug' or 'debug2' for troubleshooting.
cupsdEditor.maxLogSizeDesc: Maximum log file size in bytes. Set to 0 to disable internal log rotation.
cupsdEditor.portDesc: Port number for the CUPS web interface and IPP.
cupsdEditor.listenAddressDesc: Comma-separated list of addresses/sockets to listen on.
cupsdEditor.browsingSettingsDesc: Configure printer discovery and sharing on the network.
cupsdEditor.browsingDesc: Allow CUPS to advertise shared printers on the local network.
cupsdEditor.defaultAuthTypeDesc: Default authentication method when authentication is required.
cupsdEditor.webInterfaceDesc: Enable the CUPS web administration interface.
cupsdEditor.locationBlocksDesc: Configure access restrictions for different parts of the web interface.
cupsdEditor.policyBlocksDesc: Control access to printing operations and job management.
cupsdEditor.policyNote: Policy configurations (default, authenticated, kerberos) use standard settings. Advanced policy customization requires manual editing of the exported file.
cupsdEditor.previewDesc: Preview of the generated cupsd.conf file.

addPrinter.title: Add Printer
addPrinter.step1Desc: Enter the printer URI or discover network printers
addPrinter.step2Desc: Select the printer driver or PPD file
addPrinter.shareOnNetwork: Share this printer on the network

setup.title: Welcome to CUPS UI
setup.subtitle: Connect to your CUPS server to get started.
setup.connectionDetailsDesc: Enter your CUPS server information below.
setup.skipForNow: Skip for now and use demo mode

demo.bannerMessage: You are using demo mode with mock data.
